content: A DateInput allows users to enter and edit date/time values via the keyboard. Each part of the date is an individually editable segment. It uses objects from the `@internationalized/date` package for values.
The component supports `isDisabled`, `isReadOnly`, and `isRequired` states, similar to a standard input field.

You can control the smallest unit displayed with `granularity` (e.g., 'day', 'minute', 'second'). It is also time zone aware when using a `ZonedDateTime` object, and you can hide the time zone with `hideTimeZone`.
You can restrict the selectable range with `minValue` and `maxValue`. The `isInvalid` prop and `errorMessage` can be used to display validation errors.
DateInput supports multiple international calendar systems and automatically formats dates based on the user's locale.
Key stylable slots include `base`, `label`, `inputWrapper`, `input` (the segments container), and `segment` for individual date parts.
Each date/time unit is an individually focusable and editable segment, allowing for easy keyboard navigation and editing. It has full screen reader support with ARIA attributes.
